subject: Re: [junit] JUnit: How to disable printing dots "." on console ?
msgSnippet: ... You can deal with them together. Two things: (1) the book _JUnit Recipes_ describes exactly how to do this, so I encourage you to buy a copy. It will be
messageBody:
Mahendra Varman wrote:
> Hi all,
>
> I have a doubt/difficulty in JUnit to handle..
>
> Junit prints a dot "." on the screen as soon as it runs a test
> successfully. Is there a way to disable this feature ? I want no dots
> to be printed on the console..
>
> JUnit also prints a "F" or an "E" if it encounters failures or
> run-time errors.. Although I would like to disable these as well.. I
> would first like to deal with the "." 's..

You can deal with them together.

Two things: (1) the book _JUnit Recipes_ describes exactly how to do
this, so I encourage you to buy a copy. It will be very helpful to you
as you work with JUnit, and (2) look in the JUnit source for a class
named (if I remember correctly) ResultPrinter. Follow it to where JUnit
is using it, and you'll see what you need to do. Unfortunately, you need
to write your own custom TestRunner. Not difficult, even though it
sounds daunting.

Of course, there is a simpler option. If you want to ignore all the
output altogether, then you could just try redirecting the console to a
file or /dev/null.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
